title: Gurukul Aulmni Assocation Alumni Association App (MVP) — Frontend

requirements.summary: Create a responsive public landing page introducing the association with clear Sign in and Browse calls to action.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays the association name exactly as "Gurukul Aulmni Assocation".
Page is responsive on mobile and desktop.
Primary actions include: Sign in (Internet Identity) and Browse (read-only previews or prompt to sign in).

file_operations.description: Create the top-level app with client-side routing and a shared layout; wire the landing page route as the default entry and ensure unauthenticated users can access public routes.
Implement the public, responsive landing page copy and calls-to-action for Sign in and Browse; include a brief association intro and link users into Directory/Events/Announcements flows.
Add a shared header/navigation used across pages with prominent Sign in/Sign out and Browse links; ensure navigation works on mobile (collapsible) and desktop.
Create a shared layout wrapper (header + main + footer) to ensure consistent spacing and responsive container behavior across all required pages.

requirements.summary: Add Internet Identity sign-in/sign-out UI and show authenticated state with the user’s principal (or short form) in the header.
acceptanceCriteria: User can sign in and sign out using Internet Identity.
When signed in, the UI indicates authenticated state (e.g., principal displayed).
Unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in when attempting member-only actions.

file_operations.description: Create a Sign in / Sign out button UI by composing the existing auth hook (Internet Identity) and clearing react-query cache on logout as recommended by the authorization component. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Show authenticated state in the header: display either the saved profile full name (preferred) and also a short-form principal (to satisfy the requirement) when signed in; show Sign in when signed out. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small wrapper component to guard member-only actions/routes by checking Internet Identity presence; when unauthenticated, render a prompt and a Sign in action.

Create a hook that derives auth state (isAuthenticated, principal string/short form) from useInternetIdentity and optionally fetches the caller’s profile to display a friendly name; handle loading states to avoid UI flicker. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement signed-in user alumni profile create/update UI with validation and persistence via backend calls.
acceptanceCriteria: A signed-in user can create a profile and later edit it.
Profiles are persisted in the backend canister and reload correctly after refresh.
A user can only edit their own profile.
Validation prevents empty full name and invalid graduation year (non-numeric or unreasonable range).

file_operations.description: Implement a signed-in-only My Profile page that loads the caller’s profile, shows a form for full name, graduation year, department/major, city/country, bio, and optional contact info; include client validation (required name, reasonable numeric year) and save via backend capability.
Create a reusable profile form component (used by My Profile) with inline validation errors and consistent form styling; keep contact info optional and clearly labeled.

Add react-query hooks for fetching and saving the caller’s alumni profile and for invalidating cached profile data after successful save; gracefully handle authorization failures by showing a sign-in prompt.
Wire the My Profile page into the router and navigation; ensure it is protected by an auth guard so only signed-in users can access it.

requirements.summary: Implement a searchable alumni directory with name search, year/department filters, and a profile detail view.
acceptanceCriteria: Directory loads profiles from the backend and renders a list/grid.
Search by name works (case-insensitive).
Filters (year, department/major) narrow the results.
Clicking a directory entry opens a profile detail view.
Sensitive fields marked optional contact are not shown unless present.

file_operations.description: Create the Directory page that fetches and renders alumni profiles, provides search and filter controls (year, department/major), and supports opening a detail view on click.

Add a filter/search control component with a name search input (case-insensitive filtering), a graduation year selector populated from backend capability, and a department selector populated from backend capability.
Create a directory list/grid item component showing name, graduation year, department/major, and location (city/country), without showing optional contact unless present.
Implement a profile detail view (dialog/drawer) that opens when a directory item is clicked; show full profile fields and only render optional contact info when provided.

Add react-query hooks for loading department/year filter options and for running the directory search against backend capability; implement client-side case-insensitive name matching when appropriate.
Wire the Directory page route into the router and header navigation so users can browse from landing/header.

requirements.summary: Add Events pages for viewing upcoming/past events and an admin-only UI for creating/updating/deleting events.
acceptanceCriteria: Any user can view the list of events sorted by date.
Admin users can create, edit, and delete events from the UI.
Non-admin users cannot access event management actions (UI hidden/disabled and backend enforced).
Event changes persist and are visible to all users after refresh.

file_operations.description: Create an Events page that loads upcoming and past events from backend capability, sorts by date, and renders them in a consistent list layout with tabs/segmented control for upcoming vs past.
Create an event list item component displaying title, date/time, location, and description with responsive layout.
Create a reusable UI guard that checks admin status (via backend capability) and conditionally renders admin-only controls; show an access denied message for direct access attempts.
Implement an admin-only management panel embedded in the Events page for creating, editing, and deleting events; ensure controls are hidden/disabled for non-admin users.
Add a create/edit dialog for events with fields title, date/time, location, description; validate required fields and ensure timestamp handling is consistent for sorting.
Add react-query hooks for fetching events and performing admin mutations (create/update/delete) with optimistic UX and cache invalidation; handle authorization failures gracefully.
Add a small hook to query admin status for the current caller and provide loading/error state for admin gating in the UI.
Wire the Events page route into the router and navigation.

requirements.summary: Add Announcements page for viewing announcements and an admin-only UI for creating/deleting announcements.
acceptanceCriteria: Any user can view announcements sorted newest-first.
Admin users can create and delete announcements.
Non-admin users cannot create/delete announcements (UI + backend enforced).
Announcements persist and render correctly after refresh.

file_operations.description: Create an Announcements page that loads announcements from backend capability, sorts newest-first, and renders them in a readable layout.
Create an announcement list item component displaying title, date, and content with consistent typography and spacing.
Implement an admin-only panel embedded in the Announcements page for creating and deleting announcements; hide/disable for non-admin users using the shared admin guard.
Add a create dialog for announcements with title and content fields; validate required fields and show clear success/error states.
Add react-query hooks for fetching announcements and performing admin mutations (create/delete) with cache invalidation; handle authorization failures gracefully.
Wire the Announcements page route into the router and navigation.

requirements.summary: Create and apply a cohesive non-blue/purple visual theme across all pages and shared components.
acceptanceCriteria: App has a consistent theme across header, pages, forms, and lists.
Primary colors are not blue/purple.
Key pages (Landing, Directory, Events, Announcements, My Profile) share consistent layout and navigation.

file_operations.description: Create the global Tailwind entry with CSS variables for the theme and a cohesive palette (e.g., warm saffron/green/neutral) ensuring primary is not blue/purple; apply consistent typography and spacing defaults.
Adjust Tailwind theme extension as needed to support the chosen palette and ensure consistent component styling tokens across pages (without introducing a blue/purple primary).
Ensure consistent page container widths, spacing, and header/footer placement so Landing, Directory, Events, Announcements, and My Profile share a unified structure.

requirements.summary: Include generated static branding images and render them in the landing/header UI from static assets.
acceptanceCriteria: All required images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing/header renders the generated logo and hero/banner image from static assets (not served via backend).
Images display crisply at common screen sizes without distortion.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/gurukul-logo.dim_512x512.png and ensure it is referenced by UI components as a static file.
Add the generated static hero/banner asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/gurukul-hero.dim_1600x600.png and ensure it is referenced by UI components as a static file.
Render the generated logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/gurukul-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header with appropriate sizing to avoid distortion.
Render the generated hero/banner image from frontend/public/assets/generated/gurukul-hero.dim_1600x600.png on the landing page with responsive sizing/cropping to keep it crisp without distortion.
